io.lambdacube.aspecio.aspect.interceptor

Interface Interceptor

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnnotationInterceptor<A>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeInterceptor

    public interface Interceptor

    Interceptors intercept method calls for a certain Aspect.

    To publish an Aspect, you must register an OSGi service implementing Interceptor (or one of its derivatives) with the String property AspecioConstants.SERVICE_ASPECT containing the name of the Aspect. Optionally, it is possible to define the property AspecioConstants.SERVICE_ASPECT_EXTRAPROPERTIES to define extra Boolean service properties that will be registered with services woven with that Aspect.

    Interceptors can intercept any public method the service has, as defined by Class.getMethods().

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Interceptor NOOP
      The default Interceptor.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Advice onCall(CallContext callContext)
      Callback when a method call is intercepted.

    • Field Detail

      • NOOP

        static final Interceptor NOOP
        The default Interceptor. It doesn't alter the method execution.

    • Method Detail

      • onCall

        Advice onCall(CallContext callContext)
        Callback when a method call is intercepted.
        You should return a non-null Advice. After returning from this method, Aspecio will call Advice.initialAction() to determine the next action it has to take.
        Parameters:
        callContext - The context of that method call.
        Returns:
        The advice to execute.
